means: （用建议、指示、有益的情报等）指导( direct的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Alf offered her a part in the play he was directing.
sentence.Network_cn: 阿尔夫在他导演的戏中给她安排了一个角色。

sentence.Network_en: Who was the man directing it?
Alf Sjoberg offered her a large part in the play he was directing.
sentence.Network_cn: 阿尔夫·肖博格让她在其导演的戏中扮演重要角色。

以下编译指示（ directive ）被许多编译器认可： 任何处于这两个编译指示语句之间的数据结构，将采用 n 字节的数据对齐方式。

entry.def: Direct means moving towards a place or object, without changing direction and without stopping, for example in a journey.

example.ex: They'd come on a direct flight from Athens.
example.tran: 他们是搭乘从雅典直飞这里的航班过来的。

example.ex: ...the direct route from Amman to Bombay.
example.tran: 从安曼到孟买的直达线路

entry.tran: (光或热)直接照射的，直接接触的
entry.def: If something is in direct heat or light, it is strongly affected by the heat or light, because there is nothing between it and the source of heat or light to protect it.

example.ex: Medicines should be stored away from direct sunlight...
example.tran: 药品的储放应避免阳光直射。

example.ex: Direct illumination is harsh and unflattering.
example.tran: 直射光照明既刺目又呆板。

entry.tran: (经验、活动或系统)直接的，亲身的
entry.def: You use direct to describe an experience, activity, or system which only involves the people, actions, or things that are necessary to make it happen.

example.ex: He has direct experience of the process of privatisation...
example.tran: 他对私有化过程有着切身体会。

example.ex: He seemed to be in direct contact with the Boss...
example.tran: 他似乎直接和老板联系。

entry.def: You use direct to emphasize the closeness of a connection between two things.

example.ex: They were unable to prove that she died as a direct result of his injection...
example.tran: 他们无法证明她的死是由于他的注射直接引起的。

example.ex: His visit is direct evidence of the improvement in their relationship...
example.tran: 他的到访是他们之间关系已有所改善的明证。

entry.tran: 坦率的;率直的;直截了当的
entry.def: If you describe a person or their behaviour as direct, you mean that they are honest and open, and say exactly what they mean.

example.ex: He avoided giving a direct answer...
example.tran: 他避免作出正面回答。

example.ex: The new songs are more direct...
example.tran: 这些新歌听起来更直入人心。

entry.def: If you direct something at a particular thing, you aim or point it at that thing.

example.ex: I directed the extinguisher at the fire without effect...
example.tran: 我把灭火器对准了火焰，但没起作用。

example.ex: He directed the tiny beam of light at the roof.
example.tran: 他把那一小束光对准了屋顶。

entry.tran: 使(注意力、情感、行为等)转向;使…指向;把…引向
entry.def: If your attention, emotions, or actions are directed at a particular person or thing, you are focusing them on that person or thing.

example.ex: The learner's attention needs to be directed to the significant features...
example.tran: 需要将学习者的注意力引向那些着重点上。

example.ex: Do not be surprised if, initially, she directs her anger at you...
example.tran: 如果一上来她就冲你发火，不必惊讶。

entry.tran: 使(话语或眼神)针对，指向，冲…而来
entry.def: If a remark or look is directed at you, someone says something to you or looks at you.

example.ex: She could hardly believe the question was directed towards her...
example.tran: 她很难相信这个问题是冲她来的。

example.ex: The abuse was directed at the TV crews...
example.tran: 这些辱骂是冲着电视台的工作人员来的。

entry.def: If you direct someone somewhere, you tell them how to get there.

example.ex: Could you direct them to Dr Lamont's office, please?...
example.tran: 你能告诉他们去拉蒙特医生的办公室怎么走吗？

example.ex: Inside, a guard directed them to the right.
example.tran: 进去后，一名警卫把他们引向了右边。

entry.def: When someone directs a project or a group of people, they are responsible for organizing the people and activities that are involved.

example.ex: Christopher will direct day-to-day operations.
example.tran: 克里斯托弗将管理日常的运营。

example.ex: ...his coolness in directing the rescue of nine hostages.
example.tran: 在组织解救9名人质的过程中他所表现出的冷静

entry.tran: 导演，执导(电影、戏剧或电视节目)
entry.def: When someone directs a film, play, or television programme, they are responsible for the way in which it is performed and for telling the actors and assistants what to do.

example.ex: He directed various TV shows...
example.tran: 他执导过多种题材的电视节目。

example.ex: The film was directed by Howard Hawks.
example.tran: 该影片是由霍华德·霍克斯导演的。

entry.def: If you are directed to do something, someone in authority tells you to do it.

example.ex: They have been directed to give special attention to the problem of poverty...
example.tran: 他们得到指示要特别关注贫困问题。

example.ex: The Bishop directed the faithful to stay at home.
example.tran: 主教要求信徒们呆在家中。

entry.def: If you are a direct descendant of someone, you are related to them through your parents and your grandparents and so on.

example.ex: She is a direct descendant of Queen Victoria.
example.tran: 她是维多利亚女王的嫡系后代。

means.word_mean: 1. showing the way by conducting or leading; imposing direction on;

sentences.sentence: "felt his mother's directing arm around him"
"the directional role of science on industrial progress"

auth_sentence.content: I actually had an interest in directing Moby Dick.
auth_sentence.res_content: I actually had an interest in directing Moby Dick.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I actually had an interest in directing Moby Dick.

auth_sentence.content: They all say they love directing hard-working female players.
auth_sentence.res_content: They all say they love directing hard-working female players.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They all say they love directing hard-working female players.

auth_sentence.content: I'm just getting used to directing for movies.
auth_sentence.res_content: I'm just getting used to directing for movies.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I'm just getting used to directing for movies.

Sentence.sentence: More than half of their time is spent directing traffic and writing parking tickets.
